narrative.narrative: Air China Cargo is the cargo divison of Air China and is based at Beijing Capital Airport. It is owned 51% by Air China, 25% by CITIC Pacific, and 24% by Beijing Capital International and has about 4,000 employees. It was founded in 2003. They are consolidated with Cathay Pacific Cargo. They fly to 20 cities in 10 countries, including 5 domestic and 5 in the U.S. They have 11 planes. 3 777F's, 2 757-200PF's, 3 747F's and 3 747-400BCF's. They have 5 777F's on order and are to get 2 more 757-200PF's from their parent Air China. This information is accurate as of April 2014.
